body_html:
I think conv2d expects a 4 dimensional weight: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.functional.conv2d (you provided a 2 dimensional one). Try conv2d(Variable(torch.Tensor(1, 1, 10, 10)), Variable(torch.Tensor(1, 1, 3, 3))) instead?

Thanks for reporting the segfault though! I think we recently fixed it; testing on master gives the following error message:
body_text:
I think conv2d expects a 4 dimensional weight: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.functional.conv2d (you provided a 2 dimensional one). Try conv2d(Variable(torch.Tensor(1, 1, 10, 10)), Variable(torch.Tensor(1, 1, 3, 3))) instead?
Thanks for reporting the segfault though! I think we recently fixed it; testing on master gives the following error message:
body:
I think conv2d expects a 4 dimensional weight: http://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.functional.conv2d (you provided a 2 dimensional one). Try `conv2d(Variable(torch.Tensor(1, 1, 10, 10)), Variable(torch.Tensor(1, 1, 3, 3)))` instead?

Thanks for reporting the segfault though! I think we recently fixed it; testing on master gives the following error message:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5652049/31637498-fe457dec-b29c-11e7-921a-82630c1d4522.png)
